channel.title: In Good Faith with Chelsea & Judah Smith
channel.copyright: © Judah and Chelsea Smith. All Rights Reserved.
channel.description: IN GOOD FAITH is a podcast series hosted by Chelsea and Judah Smith and centered on their life’s work: raising a family and building a church — Churchome — a community based on the principles of compassion, belonging, and love. Taking a candid approach, our hosts will address everything from anxiety, to sex, to the frank truths about marriage. If going to church is the living room, Judah & Chelsea just want to invite you to the front porch.

item.title: The Most Important Thing in Our World: Being Loved by God
item.description:
Today marks a huge milestone for Chelsea and Judah — they've reached the Season 1 Finale of In Good Faith! To celebrate the end of this chapter, they sit down for a conversation about the single most important thing in their lives — being loved by God. They explain how they came to this realization, discuss whether or not they've ever doubted His love, and open up about some of the unique ways God has revealed Himself to each of them. They close out the episode by reflecting on Season 1, sharing some of their favorite moments, biggest takeaways, and hopes for the future.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Down in the Dumps: A Realistic Guide to Getting Un-Grumpy
item.description:
Sometimes, we just can't help but feel grumpy. But lately, Chelsea and Judah have been noticing these moods more than ever, both within themselves and in the people around them — and they're ready to talk about it. They explain how they differentiate standard grumpiness from a deeper sense of lament and grief, especially in the context of today's painful and complicated world. They also share some tools for cultivating a positive mindset without stepping into the dangerous territory of toxic positivity. And what they find is that sometimes, the smallest drop of gratitude can make all the difference.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: The Not-So-Newlywed Game
item.description:
Is it possible for two people to know everything about each other? Chelsea and Judah are coming up on 23 years of marriage, and they're about to find out. On today's episode, they challenge each other to a competition inspired by the classic game show The Newlywed Game. They cover categories ranging from "Dating & Marriage History" to "Would Your Spouse Rather?" Ultimately, these two are determined to get to the bottom of the million dollar question: Who knows who better?
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Healing Through Community: A Conversation with Mental Health Educator Minaa B.
item.description:
The path to healing isn't linear for anyone — even a mental health specialist. Chelsea and Judah are joined by therapist, wellness coach, and mental health educator Minaa B. for a poignant conversation about the emotional toll of living in today's world. Minaa opens up about her own mental health journey, explains why community-building is essential to our mental wellbeing, and advocates for self-acceptance as the first step to healing. She also discusses her vision for the Church’s role in mental health education, and shares her number one tool for surviving what can feel like a never-ending cycle of bad news.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Our Two Cents: Money, Marriage & Meeting Halfway
item.description:
You know what they say — money talks. But today, Judah and Chelsea are talking about money. In this strikingly honest conversation, they discuss their financial journey together as a couple. They reveal some of their biggest financial mistakes, share the ground rules they’ve set to limit spending, and unpack some of the most effective ways to form a healthy relationship with money. Here’s a hint — tapping into your natural strengths might just lead you in the right direction.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Grieving the Loss of a Friendship
item.description:
Some friendships last forever — but many of them don’t. On today’s episode, Judah and Chelsea sit down for a raw, emotional conversation about the recent loss of several meaningful friendships in their lives, and the grief that ensued. They also discuss why friendship breakups aren’t taken as seriously as romantic ones, and identify some signs that can help you decide whether to rekindle a friendship or truly let go.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Searching for Small Joys with Amanda Cook
item.description:
In the journey of life, we’re all seeking joy — but sometimes, it can be hard to find. Today’s guest, Amanda Cook, is a Grammy award-winning musician and songwriter who has spent years sharing her talents in the Christian community and beyond. Judah and Chelsea sit down with their dear friend for a powerful conversation about music, faith, and healing. Amanda opens up about her relationship with music, how she's embraced being an introvert, and why she cherishes the small joys in life just as much as the big ones.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Out of Office: Why Vacations Are a Form of Worship
item.description:
Everyone loves a good vacation — whether it’s exploring a new city, soaking up sun on a secluded island, or spending quality time with faraway family members. But for Judah and Chelsea, the key to a good vacation isn't a change in location... it's a change in mindset. On today’s episode, they discuss what makes a vacation truly rejuvenating, share some practical tips for planning a vacation before you're feeling burnt out, and encourage you to invest in your rest — no matter where you are.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: The Adventure of Life with Churchome's David Kroll
item.description:
Life is full of twists and turns — and if anyone can speak to that, it's today's guest. Judah and Chelsea sit down for a candid conversation with the CEO of Churchome, their dear friend David Kroll. David explains his unconventional journey to faith, and reveals how he got through some of the most tumultuous periods of his life. He encourages listeners to lean into all of life's adventures — because oftentimes, our greatest joys are the things we never saw coming.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: The Bible 101: Getting to Know God
item.description:
The Bible is at the core of every Christian's relationship with God — but no matter how many times Judah and Chelsea have read through it, they still have questions. On today's episode, they give listeners an introduction to this incredible tool — a "Bible 101," if you will. They discuss their personal relationships to The Bible, explain how they've navigated its more confusing sections, and share some tips on how to approach it if you're new to its teachings.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: The Power of "Why?"
item.description:
One of the most powerful questions a person can ask is just one word: “Why?” On today's episode, Judah and Chelsea explain how asking "Why?" again and again can help you get to the root of a problem, unpack the reason for a belief, and live a life full of curiosity and learning. They also discuss what it means to truly understand others in a world that feels increasingly divided.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: The Myth of Work-Life Balance
item.description:
Burnout is real — and it's way more common than you might think. As we close out Mental Health Awareness Month, Judah and Chelsea sit down for an honest conversation about burnout: preventing it, surviving it, and thriving in its wake. They also unpack the meaning behind "Work-Life Balance," and explain why living a "balanced" life shouldn't always be the goal.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Four Words for a Healthy Soul
item.description:
How's your soul? This is a question Judah and Chelsea have been asking themselves, each other, and their loved ones for years. (Judah even wrote a book about it!) On today's episode, the two of them discuss four words that can make or break your soul — all starting with the letter 'R'. They also share tips on how to create the optimal environment for your unique self to thrive and flourish, which during Mental Health Awareness Month, is more important than ever.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: How To Fight Fair
item.description:
Fighting with someone you love can be really difficult — just ask Judah and Chelsea. On today's episode, they open up about the fight that almost changed their relationship forever, discuss what "fighting fair" means to them, and share some tips for finding common ground and healing in the midst of conflict. It can get a little tense — but they always work it out.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Finding Your Voice: A Guide to Public Speaking
item.description:
Public speaking isn’t everyone’s cup of tea, but at one point or another, we’ve all had to do it. As two experienced — yet very different — public speakers, Judah and Chelsea have a lot of insight into what makes a speech or presentation great. (Hint: it's not just being an extrovert.) They share some tips on how to embrace your nerves, connect with your audience, tap into your unique strengths, and maybe even find some joy in the spotlight.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: The Question of Perfection
item.description:
In a world that tells us we could always be better, it's easy to fall into the trap of perfectionism. But what if we learn to invite our mistakes in, rather than push them away? Judah and Chelsea discuss all the ways in which perfectionism manifests in our lives. They reflect on their own personal journeys with perfectionism, and share some tools for combating the ever-present urge to be free of flaws.

item.title: Embracing Your Differences with Les & Leslie Parrott
item.description:
We all want to find a partner who's a good match for us, but are we looking for the right things? Les and Leslie Parrott have been studying and teaching the basics of good relationships for decades — Leslie as a marriage and family therapist, Les as a clinical psychologist, and both as Judah and Chelsea's marriage coaches. The Parrotts join In Good Faith to talk about the truth behind "opposites attract," when and when not to compromise on what you want in a partner, and how empathy is the key to connecting us all.

item.title: What You Gain When You Forgive
item.description:
Forgiveness comes in all shapes and sizes — but in every situation, one thing stays consistent. It's not for the person you're forgiving; it's for you. Judah and Chelsea explore the many misconceptions about forgiveness, and explain why letting go is the key to living a free life. This episode contains sensitive content, some of which is related to sexual and physical trauma. Please listen with care. For resources and information, visit the National Sexual Violence Resource Center at www.nsvrc.org or Rape, Abuse, & Incest National Network (RAINN), which organizes the National Sexual Assault Telephone Hotline. Everyone deserves relationships free from domestic violence. When you're ready, the National Domestic Violence Hotline is there to listen with confidential support 24/7/365. Call 1-800-799-7233, chat at thehotline.org or text “START” to 88788.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Bringing Distinction To Your Friendships
item.description:
When you're a kid, you can make friends with just about anyone — but as you get older, it's important to start thinking a little more critically about your inner circle. Do they reflect the kind of person or friend you want to be? And where do they best fit into your life? Chelsea and Judah discuss how to evaluate all of your friendships, from your bosom buddies to the ones you only see to play golf. There's a place for everyone — as long as you bring distinction.
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

item.title: Changing The Story You Tell Yourself
item.description:
Consciously or subconsciously, we all tell ourselves stories that color our worldview. But do you know what yours is? Is it true? And even more, is it serving you? item.title: Our Love Story
item.description:
Every couple has a love story... but most aren't as long as Judah and Chelsea's. They've been spending time together since they were each in their mothers' bellies. And even though it may seem like their romance was fated, they've had their share of twists, turns, awkward moments, and challenging fights... and this Valentine's Day, they're sharing everything — so you can feel the love, too. A note for our listeners with children: This episode gets a little PG-13... but it's all in the name of love.

item.title: The Key To Raising Good Adults — Not Good Kids
item.description:
There are a lot of manuals for parenting, but not one can prepare you for the reality of raising kids. And once those kids become teenagers? Good luck. item.title: History of Racism in the Church with Jemar Tisby
item.description:
Historian of race and religion Jemar Tisby joins In Good Faith to discuss the history of racism in the church and the ARC of racial justice. Tibsy is New York Times Bestselling author of The Color of Compromise and How to Fight Racism: Courageous Christianity and the Journey Toward Racial Justice. He's also founder and president of The Witness: A Black Christian Collective, where he writes about race, religion, politics, and culture, and co-host of the Pass the Mic podcast.

item.title: Introducing: In Good Faith with Judah and Chelsea Smith
item.description:
IN GOOD FAITH is a podcast series hosted by Judah and Chelsea Smith and centered on their life’s work: raising a family and building a church — Churchome — a community based on the principles of compassion, belonging, and love. Taking a candid approach, our hosts will address everything from anxiety, to sex, to the frank truths about marriage. If going to church is the living room, Judah & Chelsea just want to invite you to the front porch. New episodes are live every Monday. In Good Faith is Available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Audacy, or wherever you get your podcasts. Follow the show now! New episodes come out every week and the first full episode is out NOW!
To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy
